image.altText: Spirit of Tasmania I and the Searoad Liekut in port on the Mersey River 2024-08-22 10:08:00

props.synopsis: Tasmania's largest shipping company says it expects its Devonport operations will be "substantially" impacted by a stop-gap measure to accommodate the new Spirit of Tasmania ferries and fears there is a "huge" risk of collision.

title.children: Fears temporary port may put SeaRoad and Spirit of Tasmania ships at 'huge' risk of collision

image.altText: A worker in Hi-Vis working on a powerline.

props.synopsis: When your power goes out, it's only natural to want it resolved as soon as possible. Here's why in Tasmania that might not happen.

title.children: Power outage? Light a candle and get comfortable: What to know about the strike affecting Tasmania's network

image.altText: A render of two sheds near a massive stadium.

props.synopsis: The heritage-listed Goods Shed is set to be moved to the northern side of the proposed Hobart stadium, with renders showing it being used for events, markets and live performances.

title.children: New images show heritage-listed Goods Shed in new home near Hobart stadium

image.altText: A time lapse video of a button battery burning the body after being injested.

props.synopsis: A new study reveals the horrific injuries suffered after swallowing or inserting button batteries but manufacturers aren't prioritising their redesign.

title.children: Burning holes through a child's insides – the destructive path of a button battery

image.altText: Two men wearing hard hats and hi-visibility walk into the opening of a large tunnel, several times their height.

props.synopsis: After delays, multi-billion-dollar cost blowouts and a disappointing performance by boring machine Florence, Snowy Hydro picks up an additional boring machine hoping to make sure the project can be completed on time.

title.children: Snowy Hydro buys another boring machine, hoping to make up for lost time

image.altText: Women in white coats holding candles

props.synopsis: It's something exhausted doctors do every day – find a quiet corner of the hospital for a quick nap. But in India, it ended in a brutal murder. Will it change a nation? WARNING: The details in this story might be distressing to some readers.

title.children: An exhausted female doctor took a nap at work. What happened next has horrified India

image.altText: Hannah McGlade pictured looking pensive in a portrait taken outdoors.

props.synopsis: Experts are urging the Family, Domestic and Sexual Violence Commission to appoint an Aboriginal family violence commissioner

title.children: 'Engagement hasn't been very good': Indigenous women critical of violence prevention review

image.altText: Mike Lynch smiles as he wears a suit and walks from the High Court.

props.synopsis: The Italian coastguard say the body of Mike Lynch has been recovered from the wreckage of a superyacht.

title.children: Body of British tech entrepreneur Mike Lynch recovered from superyacht wreckage

image.altText: A woman in a tan suit smiles with her arms outstretched

props.synopsis: When the Democrat presidential candidate Kamala Harris delivers her speech to the Democratic National Convention today, style will be almost everything.

title.children: Kamala Harris has about eight seconds today to make or break her White House campaign

image.altText: People wear blood-splattered, white gowns and blue masks

props.synopsis: Australian Uyghurs want sanctions against Beijing as a report finds China has imposed 4.4 million years of cumulative imprisonment on members of the mostly Muslim ethnic group.

title.children: Fears Uyghurs may no longer 'exist as a people' without urgent action

image.altText: Vyleen White's daughter Cindy Micallef

props.synopsis: Vyleen White was stabbed to death at an Ipswich shopping centre. Six months later, police now have more powers to stop and search people there.

title.children: A 70-year-old woman was fatally stabbed at a shopping centre. Now police have the power to stop and search there

image.altText: A graphic reading death certificate

props.synopsis: Medical staff at Tasmania's second-largest hospital say what the public know is just "the tip of the iceberg" when it comes to unexpected deaths going unreported to the coroner.

title.children: 'I can't put you through': Doctor claims he wasn't allowed to contact coroner after patient's death

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair and a black jacket arrives at court

props.synopsis: The Brittany Higgins and Linda Reynolds defamation trial hears revelations lawyers have launched another lawsuit against Ms Higgins which attempts to make access to her federal government settlement easier.

title.children: Fresh lawsuit against Brittany Higgins launched by Linda Reynolds amid defamation dispute

image.altText: Pile of frozen pea packets

props.synopsis: Supermarkets are seemingly offering more brands of frozen veggies than ever — but is the increasing choice an illusion?

title.children: The rise of 'phantom brands' as supermarket giants sneak imports onto shelves, pushing Australian produce out

image.altText: A group of people placing banners outside the gate of parliament building in Jakarta

props.synopsis: The government had moved to annul two Constitutional Court rulings on regional election candidate nomination requirements, sparking massive protests across Indonesia.

title.children: Indonesian parliament cancels plan to change election rules after mass protests

image.altText: A middle-aged bald man in a suit smiles as he walks down a corridor with an ABC News logo behind him.

props.synopsis: Mr Anderson says he will remain in the role at the request of ABC chair Kim Williams until a new managing director is appointed, likely early next year.

title.children: ABC managing director David Anderson announces intention to resign from national broadcaster

image.altText: A young child gets there nose blown.

props.synopsis: Infectious disease experts say pregnant women should get vaccinated urgently as whooping cough numbers reach a nine-year high.

title.children: 'Shocking' whooping cough numbers are being reported across Australia. Here's why

image.altText: Anthony Albanese during QT

props.synopsis: It's been no secret that Australia's parliament has cultural problems; stories of bullying and intimidation in the house on the hill are the thing of legends. But there are signs of change.

title.children: Parliament was built for conflict. Now there are signs of change

image.altText: Bemir Saracevic

props.synopsis: The federal government has ordered an investigation after the ABC uncovered allegations of bikie threats towards the CFMEU on a major taxpayer-funded project in Brisbane.

title.children: Federal government orders investigation into alleged bikie threats towards CFMEU

image.altText: Two graves dug in dusty ground are adorned with flowers at a funeral in Nir Oz.

props.synopsis: Avraham Munder was among the 70 people taken hostage during the October 7 attack on his kibbutz, and he has now finally been laid to rest alongside his son by grieving and angry family and loved ones.

title.children: As Israeli hostages killed in Gaza are laid to rest, their families unleash their rage at Netanyahu

image.altText: a gas ship being guided into Darwin harbour by a tug boat

props.synopsis: In a senate inquiry report, the Greens and high-profile crossbencher David Pocock have called for an investigation into the federal government's $1.5 billion commitment to the Middle Arm Industrial Precinct and recommended funds be directed away from supporting fossil fuel projects.

title.children: David Pocock, Greens call for investigation into $1.5 billion Middle Arm investment 'shrouded in secrecy'

image.altText: Lachlan Galvin of the Wests Tigers looks to pass the ball

props.synopsis: Wests Tigers have produced the upset of the NRL season, coming from 16 points down to defeat sixth-placed Manly at Leichhardt Oval.

title.children: Manly blow 16-point lead and have three players sent to the sin-bin, as last placed Tigers produce upset of the year

image.altText: Pink roses.

props.synopsis: A bouquet of flowers is the go-to gift for many special occasions but the world is paying a high price for transporting our out-of-season blooms.

title.children: In Europe's flower capital, 'it's almost not possible' to grow them anymore

image.altText: Izak Rankine of the Crows is knocked out by a hit from Dan Houston

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide have failed to downgrade Dan Houston's five-match ban at the AFL Appeals Board, meaning the star defender's season is now over.

title.children: Houston's season over as Port fail to overturn five-match ban for Showdown hit

image.altText: A man takes a selfie photo with two teenage boys behind him.

props.synopsis: Rodger Goltz lived an adventurous life, but only after his tragic death in a skydiving accident did his family realise his life insurance policy did not cover everything.

title.children: Father of six's skydiving death not covered by life insurance

image.altText: Green fields and some small buildings are seen with plumes of smoke rising and small yellow explosions from above

props.synopsis: Ukrainian intelligence could be targeting Russian forces using social media or geolocation data, the interior ministry said via Telegram.

title.children: Ukraine is using social media to locate Russian military bases, Kursk residents warned

image.altText: Monash IVF sign

props.synopsis: More than 700 patients filed a class action against the fertility company, claiming potentially viable embryos were wrongfully discarded and misused.

title.children: Monash IVF agrees to $56m settlement over alleged improper use of patient embryos

image.altText: An inflatable slide attached to the side of a Jetstar aeroplane.

props.synopsis: The flight from Sydney had just parked at Melbourne Airport when a man opened an emergency exit door, in a situation a passenger described as "really strange".

title.children: Jetstar passenger describes how man 'ripped off' plane's emergency exit door at Melbourne Airport

image.altText: a landscape shot of a small rundown petrol station, there is a few petrol pumps and old signage

props.synopsis: A Central Coast landowner is awarded significant damages after petroleum and diesel from a neighbouring service station contaminates his property.

title.children: Petrol station operator ordered to pay neighbour $9 million over fuel contamination

image.altText: Indigenous woman looks out the window from the rundown kitchen.

props.synopsis: A class action has been filed against the West Australian government on behalf of thousands of tenants living in substandard public housing in remote Aboriginal communities.

title.children: These Australians have been 'ignored and forgotten' in the housing crisis

image.altText: Surfers and swimmers in the water at Bondi Beach in calm conditions.

props.synopsis: Above-average temperatures are forecast all across Australia as we reach the tail end of winter. But is the cold weather truly behind us?

title.children: Extraordinary August heat is threatening all-time seasonal records in multiple states. But are the winter days really behind us?

image.altText: A gorgeous Black teenager smiling at the camera, with a beautiful head of curls

props.synopsis: Sole Sista explores isolation, and the fish-out-of-water experience. Teen director and Sydneysider Emerie Boone made the film at the Black Girl Film Camp in the United States.

title.children: Teen director Emerie Boone wins international awards for short film Sole Sista

image.altText: Jayson Gillham sits on a step outside in a professional portrait photo

props.synopsis: Jayson Gillham, whose scheduled performance with the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra was abruptly cancelled last week, talks about choosing to highlight the plight of journalists in Gaza at concert.

title.children: Pianist had 'no idea' his Gaza comments would spark a firestorm with the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra

image.altText: A young girl wearing a hat, in front of flowers and grass.

props.synopsis: Laila Johnson, 11, was stabbed in London during a random attack last week. Her family says the "strong and resilient" girl is remaining positive and returned to school in Candelo today.

title.children: Mum reveals 'pure terror' of seeing daughter stabbed in London attack
